==Applies To==

* Web Applications
* Server-side

==What to Do==

Deny all access by default by configuring web server settings and implementing authorization code accordingly.

==Why==

Denying all access by default assures that only explicitly authorized access is possible.

==When==

Deny all access by default in all web applications that implement access control.

==How==

To deny all access by default:

# **Enumerate all sensitive pages.** Make a list of all pages that handle sensitive or private information.
# **Configure web-server authorization.** Configure the web-server to deny all access by default for all locations that contain sensitive pages or data. The exact procedures are different for different web servers - please, refer to your web server's documentation for detailed instructions on configuring its access control settings.
# **Deny all access by default in your authorization code.** Implement authorization in your application to deny all access by default.
